page.title: 06HARTALOO AND BROOK BANK FM.
page.content: {HARTALOO FARM }My uncle is a dairy farmer,he has 190 milking cows. The average yield is about 1,130000 litres per year. 25% stock is either sold or slaughtered each year.The food he uses is grass in the summer and dairy cake in the winter.All the milk is taken by milktankers to Maelor for the Milk Marketing Board. The average price he buys a milking cow is about Â£550.Last winter it took one and a quarter hours to milk ten cows because the milk froze as it came from the cows into the jars. Normally to milk all the cows takes 3 hours in the morning and 2 hours in the evening.He enjoys his job in the summer but not in winter. { } Jonathan. {BROOK BANK FARM }MY dad is a dairy farmer.He milks 65 cows.He gets 6500 litres per cow per year. The hightest yield for a cow is 8000 litres. (Cont)
